author: Qrius
title: Explained – Here is what caused a 10% fall in shares of this real estate company
text:
Shares of TARC Ltd., the New Delhi-based construction company known to develop housing, commercial properties, hotels, resorts and other real estate are locked in a 10% lower circuit on Tuesday, December 17. Company Value Change %Change The company said in an exchange filing on Tuesday that market regulator Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) through a letter on Monday, has informed the company about the appointment of a forensic auditor with regards to financial statements of the company for financial year 2020-21 to 2022-23.
“SEBI believes that the disclosure of financial information and business transactions of the company have been dealt with in a manner which may be detrimental to the interest of investors or the securities market and / or an intermediary or a person associated with the securities market,” TARC said in its filing.
In response, TARC said that it will provide all the necessary information, assistance and co-operation in this regard.
“The company remains committed to maintaining the highest standards of corporate governance, ensuring that all processes are conducted with integrity and transparency,” the TARC clarification read.
TARC went on to say that this will have no impact on financial, operational or any other strategic objectives of the company and that the “strong growth trajectory” of the company will not be affected.”
Shares of TARC are trading 10% lower on Tuesday at ₹187.92. The stock is down 31% from its recent peak of ₹269.
